<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FED
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/13/us-lawmakers-lob-tough-questions-judy-shelton?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
U.S. Senate Judges Judy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Judy Shelton testifies before the Senate Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs Committee" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxNjI3MTU5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sarah Silbiger/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Senate Banking Committee <a href="https://www.axios.com/trump-fed-pick-judy-shelton-nomination-hearing-f14fd07f-4bc6-4c5f-a295-4434a939031f.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grilled</a> one of President Trump’s recent nominees to the Federal Reserve, Judy Shelton. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shelton, a conservative economist, was an adviser to Trump’s 2016 campaign and U.S. director of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Shelton is also a lightning rod</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">She’s drawn skepticism on the Hill from both parties. To start, Shelton supports lowering interest rates to push down the dollar’s value and counter similar measures by other countries. That kind of dollar manipulation is traditionally in the Treasury’s tote bag, not the Fed’s...and could provoke foreign governments. Which is kinda Shelton’s point.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sen. Pat Toomey (R-PA) echoed other senators when he said, “That’s a very, very dangerous path to go down.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Second, Shelton has argued for a return to <a href="https://www.cato.org/sites/cato.org/files/serials/files/cato-journal/2012/7/v32n2-9.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">something like the gold standard</a> throughout her career, including <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-case-for-monetary-regime-change-11555873621?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as recently</a> as last April. The U.S. dropped the gold standard back in 1971, and most economists believe it would tank the economy.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But in her testimony, Shelton said she “would not advocate going back to a prior historical monetary arrangement.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Third, Shelton has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-feds-mandate-is-up-to-congress-and-the-president-11568673581?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">questioned the Fed</a> as an independent entity. That raised bipartisan hackles—it’s an article of D.C. faith that Jerome Powell does his thing, Trump does his, and never the twain shall meet.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Yesterday, Shelton said it is “vital” that the Fed stays separate from the political thicket. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those reversals didn’t exactly endear her—some economic commentators <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/which-judy-shelton-will-the-fed-get-gold-standard-advocate-or-trump-defender-2020-01-28?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were quick to call them</a> flip-flops. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking ahead </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump and Shelton’s Republican Party has a one-person majority on the Banking Committee. So Shelton can’t lose more than one R vote. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking further ahead...</strong>Axios’s Felix Salmon <a href="https://www.axios.com/judy-shelton-federal-reserve-independence-622d1167-cc9f-4646-9a34-d01dbc71761b.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> that “if Shelton is confirmed, and if Trump is re-elected, she would immediately become the frontrunner to be the next Fed chair.” Remember, Trump has a hate-hate relationship with current Chair Jerome Powell.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/13/mcclatchy-files-bankruptcy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wherever Newspapers Hide, the Bankruptcy Party Finds Them
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An empty newspaper stand " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxNjM1MDc5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">McClatchy, the company that runs the Miami Herald, The Kansas City Star, and 28 other newspapers in 14 states, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/mcclatchy-publisher-dozens-u-s-newspapers-files-bankruptcy-protection-n1136256?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy</a> yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To keep the presses humming, McClatchy struck a $50 million financing deal with Encina Business Credit so it can stay afloat through the bankruptcy proceedings. Pending court approval, it will be taken over by hedge fund Chatham Asset Management, McClatchy’s biggest creditor. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The filing outlines a plan to eliminate about 60% of McClatchy’s $700 million in debt. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So...we good? </strong>Not if we’re the newspaper biz. Paper companies <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/02/13/newspaper-giant-mcclatchy-files-bankruptcy-hobbled-by-debt-declining-print-revenue/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">haven’t adjusted</a> to the seismic shift in news consumption brought by the system of tubes you’re using to read this newsletter. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Since 2004, 20% of all U.S. newspapers have closed and the sector has axed 47% of jobs, per PEN America. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">McClatchy is the perfect case study. </strong>It cracked under the weight of pension obligations it handed out in more abundant times. According to Chairman Kevin McClatchy, the company has 10 pensioners for every active employee.</p>

AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/13/tesla-set-raise-2-billion-stock-offering?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Elon Cashes In
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="GIF of a Tesla vehicle rolling in " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1581626062.gif">

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="GIF of a Tesla vehicle rolling in " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1581626062.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Elon Musk, Jan. 29: “It doesn’t make sense to raise money.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Elon Musk, Feb. 13: Tesla’s <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-offering/tesla-seeks-to-tap-into-stock-surge-with-2-billion-share-sale-idUSKBN2071OY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raising $2 billion</a> in a stock offering of 2.65 million shares.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happened over those 15 days? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/07/tesla-stock-short-squeeze-something-else?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tesla stock rose</a> as much as 52% then settled into a monster <span>~$145 billion</span> market cap. The announcement surprised investors because, as you just read, Musk assured investors Tesla didn’t need to raise funds. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last May, Tesla completed a $2.7 billion stock and bond sale...when its share price was </span><span><span>~$250</span></span><span> instead of $800.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla is using the <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/07/secondary_offering.asp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">secondary offering</a> to improve its balance sheet. The company is sitting on $13.4 billion of outstanding debt, but it has big expansion plans like a Berlin Gigafactory, more batteries to meet increased production, and some new vehicle models, including a pickup. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>Yesterday, Tesla disclosed it’s <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/13/21136080/tesla-sec-investigation-closed-model-3-production-subpoena?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">facing an SEC probe</a> over its financing arrangements. The SEC <span>subpoenaed the company as part of that investigation</span> the same day it closed a different probe into Model 3 production.</p>

</table>
<img alt="Golf course " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTU0L2dvbGZfY291cnNlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before you read this news, promise yourself you won’t make a rash decision: Retirement accounts hit <a href="https://apnews.com/cb3b48253eba90b97d96848b0e11bf42?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record highs in Q4 2019</a>, according to Fidelity.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The average 401(k) and IRA balance was up 17% annually to $112,300 and $115,400, respectively. And there are a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/13/fidelity-there-is-now-a-record-number-of-401k-and-ira-millionaires.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record 441,000</a> 401(k) and IRA millionaires. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Thank the stock market: the S&P returned ~30% last year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Then thank yourself for exclusively buying Two Buck Chuck. Workers funneled almost 9% of their pay into 401(k)s in Q4, and employer matching pushed the average savings rate to 13.5%. More employers are also automatically upping worker contributions. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stats 101:</strong> Fidelity cites the <strong style="color:#000">average</strong> balance, which can be skewed higher because it’s influenced by the top 1% of accounts. The <strong style="color:#000">median</strong> 401(k) is $27,000, but that’s skewed lower because of accounts with $0. The takeaway? Using one number to represent the 27.2 million accounts managed by Fidelity only tells you so much. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The less good news: With an average balance of $210,400, boomers are in trouble. And while 32% of employers offer managed accounts, many lower-income workers aren't given access to retirement options. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/13/brews-weekly-news-quiz-february-14?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Quiz From a Rose
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Roses are red. Our plants are brown. The blue whale has the largest heart on earth, at 1,500 pounds. Happy Valentine’s Day from the Brew’s Weekly News Quiz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. Which brings in <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/12/new-report-reveals-valentines-day-isnt-lucrative-local-restaurants?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more money</a> on average for local restaurants, according to Womply: An average Saturday night <em>or</em> a weekday Valentine’s?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. <strong style="color:#000">Match the M&A pairs. </strong>True, not all of these deals <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/10/monday-busy-day-ma?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worked out</a>, but...better to have merged and lost, than never to have merged at all. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Set 1: </strong></span><span>T-Mobile, HP, Taubman, Harry’s </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Set 2: </strong></span><span>Simon, Sprint, Edgewell, Xerox</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3.<strong style="color:#000"> Fill in the blank: </strong>Meditation company Headspace raised <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/12/meditation-company-headspace-raises?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$93 million this week</a>, but it still has to contend with ______, a rival app that reached unicorn status last February.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. Which company is the biggest <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/11/unpacking-samsungs-unpacked-event-san-francisco?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">smartphone maker</a> in the world? Hint: It introduced a foldable flip phone this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. Last Saturday night, a British Airways 747 completed the fastest <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/british-airways-747-sets-record-new-york-london-subsonic-flight?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">subsonic flight</a> between NYC and London ever recorded. How long did it take? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>5–6 hours</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>4–5 hours</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>3–4 hours</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>3 minutes</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><strong style="color:#000">Answers: </strong>1. Average Saturday night 2. T-Mobile/Sprint; Taubman/Simon; HP/Xerox; Harry's/Edgewell 3. Calm 4. Samsung 5. It took 4 hours and 56 minutes, so b. </em></sup></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MERGER WEEK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So You’re Merged...Now What?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Merger Week Banner " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxNjMyNjM5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The ink is dry. Stocks have been exchanged. We had to call Uncle Larry an Uber. The merger is officially done.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Except...the hard part is just beginning, because your two companies have <em>very </em>different workplace cultures. You have happy hours, they have Catan tournaments. You eat Chipotle, they eat Sweetgreen. You say Cool Whip, they say Cool Hwhip. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On the second-to-last day of Merger Week, we explore how mergers force companies with distinct cultures to operate as a single, cohesive unit. As the Brew’s Jamie Wilde explains, there’s a right way to do it (Disney/Pixar) and a not right way to do it (Amazon/Whole Foods). <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/13/honeymoon-merger-needs-culture-prenup?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read the piece here</a>. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FRIDAY PUZZLE
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Follow our thought process: </strong>Friday Puzzle should be linked to Merger Week...Friday Puzzle is about words...Merger Week is about things that compound...words...compounds...compound words! </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Here’s the puzzle: </strong>Just as there are reverse mergers, there are reverse compound words (e.g. turnover and overturn). Can you identify the reverse compound words from these clues? </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An unexpected victory by a lesser team & a plan that makes use of an unsuspecting person</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A short break between airplane flights & a transparent sheet placed on top of another sheet</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A sudden eruption of a disease & a prison escape</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To maintain a principle & a bank robbery using guns</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Food sold to be eaten elsewhere & a film clip left on the editing room floor</span></li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nFED \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/13/us-lawmakers-lob-tough-questions-judy-shelton?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nU.S. Senate Judges Judy\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Judy Shelton testifies before the Senate Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs Committee\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxNjI3MTU5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSarah Silbiger/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Senate Banking Committee \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/trump-fed-pick-judy-shelton-nomination-hearing-f14fd07f-4bc6-4c5f-a295-4434a939031f.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrilled\u003c/a\u003e one of President Trump’s recent nominees to the Federal Reserve, Judy Shelton. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShelton, a conservative economist, was an adviser to Trump’s 2016 campaign and U.S. director of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eShelton is also a lightning rod\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShe’s drawn skepticism on the Hill from both parties. To start, Shelton supports lowering interest rates to push down the dollar’s value and counter similar measures by other countries. That kind of dollar manipulation is traditionally in the Treasury’s tote bag, not the Fed’s...and could provoke foreign governments. Which is kinda Shelton’s point.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSen. Pat Toomey (R-PA) echoed other senators when he said, “That’s a very, very dangerous path to go down.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSecond, Shelton has argued for a return to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cato.org/sites/cato.org/files/serials/files/cato-journal/2012/7/v32n2-9.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esomething like the gold standard\u003c/a\u003e throughout her career, including \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-case-for-monetary-regime-change-11555873621?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas recently\u003c/a\u003e as last April. The U.S. dropped the gold standard back in 1971, and most economists believe it would tank the economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut in her testimony, Shelton said she “would not advocate going back to a prior historical monetary arrangement.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThird, Shelton has \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-feds-mandate-is-up-to-congress-and-the-president-11568673581?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equestioned the Fed\u003c/a\u003e as an independent entity. That raised bipartisan hackles—it’s an article of D.C. faith that Jerome Powell does his thing, Trump does his, and never the twain shall meet.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, Shelton said it is “vital” that the Fed stays separate from the political thicket. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose reversals didn’t exactly endear her—some economic commentators \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/which-judy-shelton-will-the-fed-get-gold-standard-advocate-or-trump-defender-2020-01-28?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere quick to call them\u003c/a\u003e flip-flops. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking ahead \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump and Shelton’s Republican Party has a one-person majority on the Banking Committee. So Shelton can’t lose more than one R vote. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking further ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eAxios’s Felix Salmon \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/judy-shelton-federal-reserve-independence-622d1167-cc9f-4646-9a34-d01dbc71761b.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e that “if Shelton is confirmed, and if Trump is re-elected, she would immediately become the frontrunner to be the next Fed chair.” Remember, Trump has a hate-hate relationship with current Chair Jerome Powell.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMcClatchy, the company that runs the Miami Herald, The Kansas City Star, and 28 other newspapers in 14 states, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/mcclatchy-publisher-dozens-u-s-newspapers-files-bankruptcy-protection-n1136256?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled for Chapter 11 bankruptcy\u003c/a\u003e yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo keep the presses humming, McClatchy struck a $50 million financing deal with Encina Business Credit so it can stay afloat through the bankruptcy proceedings. Pending court approval, it will be taken over by hedge fund Chatham Asset Management, McClatchy’s biggest creditor. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe filing outlines a plan to eliminate about 60% of McClatchy’s $700 million in debt. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo...we good? \u003c/strong\u003eNot if we’re the newspaper biz. Paper companies \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/02/13/newspaper-giant-mcclatchy-files-bankruptcy-hobbled-by-debt-declining-print-revenue/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehaven’t adjusted\u003c/a\u003e to the seismic shift in news consumption brought by the system of tubes you’re using to read this newsletter. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSince 2004, 20% of all U.S. newspapers have closed and the sector has axed 47% of jobs, per PEN America. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMcClatchy is the perfect case study. \u003c/strong\u003eIt cracked under the weight of pension obligations it handed out in more abundant times. According to Chairman Kevin McClatchy, the company has 10 pensioners for every active employee.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happened over those 15 style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTesla stock rose\u003c/a\u003e as much as 52% then settled into a monster \u003cspan\u003e~$145 billion\u003c/span\u003e market cap. The announcement surprised investors because, as you just read, Musk assured investors Tesla didn’t need to raise funds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast May, Tesla completed a $2.7 billion stock and bond sale...when its share price was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e~$250\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e instead of $800.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla is using the \u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/07/secondary_offering.asp?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecondary offering\u003c/a\u003e to improve its balance sheet. The company is sitting on $13.4 billion of outstanding debt, but it has big expansion plans like a Berlin Gigafactory, more batteries to meet increased production, and some new vehicle models, including a pickup. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here: \u003c/strong\u003eYesterday, Tesla disclosed it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/13/21136080/tesla-sec-investigation-closed-model-3-production-subpoena?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efacing an SEC probe\u003c/a\u003e over its financing arrangements. The SEC \u003cspan\u003esubpoenaed the company as part of that investigation\u003c/span\u003e the same day it closed a different probe into Model 3 production.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe average 401(k) and IRA balance was up 17% annually to $112,300 and $115,400, respectively. And there are a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/13/fidelity-there-is-now-a-record-number-of-401k-and-ira-millionaires.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord 441,000\u003c/a\u003e 401(k) and IRA millionaires. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThank the stock market: the S\u0026P returned ~30% last year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThen thank yourself for exclusively buying Two Buck Chuck. Workers funneled almost 9% of their pay into 401(k)s in Q4, and employer matching pushed the average savings rate to 13.5%. More employers are also automatically upping worker contributions. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStats 101:\u003c/strong\u003e Fidelity cites the \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eaverage\u003c/strong\u003e balance, which can be skewed higher because it’s influenced by the top 1% of accounts. The \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003emedian\u003c/strong\u003e 401(k) is $27,000, but that’s skewed lower because of accounts with $0. The takeaway? Using one number to represent the 27.2 million accounts managed by Fidelity only tells you so much. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe less good news: With an average balance of $210,400, boomers are in trouble. The merger is officially done.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eExcept...the hard part is just beginning, because your two companies have \u003cem\u003every \u003c/em\u003edifferent workplace cultures.
